responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Server-side template injection via callback function names.
    analysis: |
      The template engine allows passing callback functions to the template context, which can be invoked during template rendering.
      If an attacker can control the names of these callback functions, they might be able to achieve remote code execution.
      For instance, an attacker might be able to pass a function name like "os.system" or any other sensitive function available in the application's scope.
    cwe: CWE-94
    function_names: []
    filenames:
      - tests/callback.html
    classification: slightly promising
```

leads.headline: Server-side template injection via callback function names.
leads.analysis:
The template engine allows passing callback functions to the template context, which can be invoked during template rendering.
If an attacker can control the names of these callback functions, they might be able to achieve remote code execution.
For instance, an attacker might be able to pass a function name like "os.system" or any other sensitive function available in the application's scope.
